practiceAreas: Construction Law|Civil Litigation|Personal Injury|Medical Malpractice|Judgement Enforcement and Collection
description:
The Bethesda, Maryland, construction law firm of Bramnick Creed, LLC, represents contractors, subcontractors, materials suppliers and even homeowners in various construction-related matters, ranging from payment disputes to breaches of contract to violations of home improvement regulations. Our team is just as happy to draft and review contracts as we are to go to bat for clients in court. Though we pride ourselves on our extensive litigation experience, we understand the value of alternative dispute resolution and attempt to resolve issues amicably before going to trial.

Our law firm is a strictly civil litigation practice. As such, our team of five attorneys is well-equipped to guide clients through a number of delicate and often time-sensitive legal matters, including those related to the following:

  • Judgment enforcement and collection
  • Personal injury
  • Medical malpractice
  • Business torts
  • Commercial and residential real estate disputes

We use each in-person and virtual appointment to build creative solutions for clients' most complex problems. Though we have robust ADR, mediation and negotiation training and experience, we are prepared to litigate each case through trial and appeal.

The lawyers of Bramnick Creed, LLC, have a long-standing reputation for providing superior legal services to businesses and individuals throughout Maryland. Maryland and D.C. Super Lawyers magazine routinely recognizes founding attorney Michael J. Bramnick as a "Super Lawyer," and Bethesda Magazine voted him as a "Top Lawyer" in 2019.

Partner and founding attorney Joseph M. Creed also earned a "Top Lawyer" designation in 2019. He authored a chapter in the Maryland Employment Law Deskbook titled "Employment Rights of Federal Employees" and served as the employee co-chair of the American Bar Association's Federal Sector Labor and Employment Law Committee. Our law firm happily accepts credit cards as payment.
